Expand hesim_data

Source: R/input-data.R
expand_hesim_data.Rd

Expand the data tables from an object of class hesim_data into a single data.table of class "expanded_hesim_data". See the description of the return value for details on how this is done.

expand_hesim_data(data, by = c("strategies", "patients"))

Arguments

data

An object of class hesim_data.
by

A character vector of the names of the data tables in hesim_data to expand by.

Value

This function is similar to expand.grid, but works for data frames or data tables. Specifically, it creates a data.table from all combinations of the supplied tables in data. The supplied tables are determined using the by argument. The resulting dataset is sorted by prioritizing id variables as follows: (i) strategy_id, (ii) line, (iii) patient_id, (iv) the health-related id variable (either state_id or transition_id).

Examples

dt_strategies <- data.frame(strategy_id = c(1, 2))
dt_patients <- data.frame(patient_id = seq(1, 3), age = c(65, 50, 75),
                          gender = c("Female", "Female", "Male"))
dt_lines <- create_lines_dt(list(c(1, 2, 5), c(1, 2)))
dt_states <- data.frame(state_id =  seq(1, 3),
                        state_var = c(2, 1, 9))
hesim_dat <- hesim_data(strategies = dt_strategies,
                        patients = dt_patients,
                        states = dt_states,
                        lines = dt_lines)
expand_hesim_data(hesim_dat, by = c("strategies", "patients"))
#> $data
#>    strategy_id patient_id age gender
#> 1:           1          1  65 Female
#> 2:           1          2  50 Female
#> 3:           1          3  75   Male
#> 4:           2          1  65 Female
#> 5:           2          2  50 Female
#> 6:           2          3  75   Male
#> 
#> $id_vars
#> [1] "strategy_id" "patient_id" 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "expanded_hesim_data"
